00111 #include "PoolAlloc.h"
00112 
00113 //
00114 // Put POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE in base classes to make them use this scheme.
00115 //
00116 #define POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE(A)                                  \
00117     void* operator new(size_t s) { return (A).allocate(s); }          \
00118     void* operator new(size_t, void *_Where) { return (_Where);   }     \
00119     void operator delete(void*) { }                                   \
00120     void operator delete(void *, void *) { }                          \
00121     void* operator new[](size_t s) { return (A).allocate(s); }        \
00122     void* operator new[](size_t, void *_Where) { return (_Where); } \
00123     void operator delete[](void*) { }                                 \
00124     void operator delete[](void *, void *) { }
00125 
00126 #define TBaseMap std::map
00127 #define TBaseList std::list
00128 #define TBaseSet std::set
00129 
00130 //
00131 // Pool version of string.
00132 //
00133 typedef pool_allocator<char> TStringAllocator;
00134 typedef std::basic_string <char, std::char_traits<char>, TStringAllocator > TString;
00135 inline TString* NewPoolTString(const char* s)
00136 {
00137    void* memory = GlobalPoolAllocator.allocate(sizeof(TString));
00138    return new(memory) TString(s);
00139 }
00140 
00141 //
00142 // Pool allocator versions of vectors, lists, and maps
00143 //
00144 template <class T> class TVector : public std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T> >
00145 {
00146 public:
00147    typedef typename std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T> >::size_type size_type;
00148    TVector() : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T> >()
00149    {
00150    }
00151    TVector(const pool_allocator<T>& a) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T> >(a)
00152    {
00153    }
00154    TVector(size_type i): std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T> >(i)
00155    {
00156    }
00157 };
00158 
00159 template <class T> class TList   : public TBaseList  <T, pool_allocator<T> >
00160 {
00161 public:
00162    typedef typename TBaseList<T, pool_allocator<T> >::size_type size_type;
00163    TList() : TBaseList<T, pool_allocator<T> >()
00164    {
00165    }
00166    TList(const pool_allocator<T>& a) : TBaseList<T, pool_allocator<T> >(a)
00167    {
00168    }
00169    TList(size_type i): TBaseList<T, pool_allocator<T> >(i)
00170    {
00171    }
00172 };
00173 
00174 // This is called TStlSet, because TSet is taken by an existing compiler class.
00175 template <class T, class CMP> class TStlSet : public std::set<T, CMP, pool_allocator<T> >
00176 {
00177    // No pool allocator versions of constructors in std::set.
00178 };
00179 
00180 
00181 template <class K, class D, class CMP = std::less<K> > 
00182 class TMap : public TBaseMap<K, D, CMP, pool_allocator<std::pair<K, D> > >
00183 {
00184 public:
00185    typedef pool_allocator<std::pair <K, D> > tAllocator;
00186 
00187    TMap() : TBaseMap<K, D, CMP, tAllocator >()
00188    {
00189    }
00190    // use correct two-stage name lookup supported in gcc 3.4 and above
00191    TMap(const tAllocator& a) : TBaseMap<K, D, CMP, tAllocator>(TBaseMap<K, D, CMP, tAllocator >::key_compare(), a)
00192    {
00193    }
00194 };
00195 
00196 //
00197 // Persistent string memory.  Should only be used for strings that survive
00198 // across compiles/links.
00199 //
00200 typedef std::basic_string<char> TPersistString;
00201 
00202 //
00203 // templatized min and max functions.
00204 //
00205 template <class T> T Min(const T a, const T b)
00206 {
00207    return a < b ? a : b;
00208 }
00209 template <class T> T Max(const T a, const T b)
00210 {
00211    return a > b ? a : b;
00212 }
00213 
00214 //
00215 // Create a TString object from an integer.
00216 //
00217 inline const TString String(const int i, const int base = 10)
00218 {
00219    char text[16];     // 32 bit ints are at most 10 digits in base 10
00220 
00221    // we assume base 10 for all cases
00222    sprintf(text, "%d", i);
00223 
00224    return text;
00225 }
00226 
00227 const unsigned int SourceLocLineMask = 0xffff;
00228 const unsigned int SourceLocStringShift = 16;
00229 
00230 __inline TPersistString FormatSourceLoc(const TSourceLoc loc)
00231 {
00232    char locText[64];
00233 
00234    int string = loc >> SourceLocStringShift;
00235    int line = loc & SourceLocLineMask;
00236 
00237    if (line)
00238       sprintf(locText, "%d:%d", string, line);
00239    else
00240       sprintf(locText, "%d:? ", string);
00241 
00242    return TPersistString(locText);
00243 }

00247 #else
00248 typedef TMap<const TString, TString> TPragmaTable;
00249 #endif
00250 typedef TMap<TString, TString>::tAllocator TPragmaTableAllocator;
